column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////We started off with the JINYA bun
column3: and the crispy chicken. The JINYA bun and crispy chicken were my favorites. The JINYA bun had the Chashu pork
column4: and was garnished with pickles and lettuce. The pork was tender and very flavorful. The crispy chicken was a big hit at lunch. It's essentially dark meat chicken
column5: but the batter and chicken are seasoned well. It comes with a side sauce
column6: but it wasn't necessary since the chicken was delicious by itself. The brussel sprouts were ok. I couldn't taste the truffle oil at all
column7: and overall the dish was bland. If it came with a tempura dipping sauce that would have helped. I wouldn't order the brussel sprouts again.
